definition: imperial five punishments of feudal China, up to Han times: tattooing characters on the forehead 墨[mo4], cutting off the nose 劓[yi4], amputation of one or both feet 刖[yue4], castration 宮|宫[gong1], execution 大辟[da4 pi4]/Han dynasty onwards: whipping 笞[chi1], beating the legs and buttocks with rough thorns 杖[zhang4], forced labor 徒[tu2], exile or banishment 流[liu2], capital punishment 死[si3]
five/5
punishment/penalty/sentence/torture/corporal punishment
surname Xing

sentences.english: The five chief forms of punishment in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 五刑是中国古代的统治者用来统治人民的刑罚。

sentences.english: Within the traditional system of five punishments, banishment was a severe sentence second only to a sentence of death.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的五刑制中，流刑处于降死一等的重刑地位。

definition: death sentence/crime punishable by death
corporal punishment consisting of carving and inking characters on the victim's forehead
corporal punishment (such as castration or amputation)
the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
castration (archaic punishment)
sentence/penalty/punishment
whipping with bamboo strips (as corporal punishment)
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
a cudgel/CL:根[gen1]
to tear off a person's four limbs and head using five horse drawn carts (as capital punishment)/to tear limb from limb
to tattoo the face (punishment in ancient times)
criminal law
public execution (old)
criminal to be executed/to execute a criminal
executed/to suffer corporal punishment or execution
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
